page.title: 08INDUSTRY IN CRUDEN BAY.
page.content: My class visited the brickworks.When we arrived a man showed us round. First of all he showed us the digger which took out the clay and put it into a machine which broke it into small bits. Next we came to a conveyer belt and saw the small bits coming through. At the end of the conveyer belt there were big round concrete crushers to flatten the clay. All the machines were very noisy. After that we went to the old part of the building where they kept the old things which they used to use. We were then shown the place where the clay is cut and made into pipes. The pipes were all wet and slimy. They had to be cooked. We went to the oven. There was a great big tube which was full of fire. This was to cook the pipes. Altogether it was an interesting afternoon.
